Sentencas: Proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (H-SOFCs), as highly efficient energy devices for power generation, are allowed to be operated at intermediate temperatures (673 K-973 K), owing to the high ionic conductivities of proton-conducting electrolytes.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: In fact, besides protons, oxygen vacancies also exist as ionic-charged carriers in proton-conducting electrolytes.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: However, the role of the oxygen-ionic current (jO) in the proton-conducting electrolyte has been overlooked to date.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: Since the type of conducting ions in the electrolytes has a significant impact on the electrode design and energy performance of SOFCs, it is significant to quantitatively evaluate the contribution of jO in proton-conducting electrolytes.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: In this study, a theoretical model, considering three types of mobile defects (proton, oxygen vacancy, electron-hole), is built.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: For the first time, a multifactor theoretical analysis is conducted for evaluating jO in H-SOFCs at various electrode humidity, operating temperature, and external current density (jext).
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: The modeling results reveal that at relatively large jext (> 0.8 A/cm2), jO is mainly influenced by the humidity of fuel (PfuelH2O), rather than the humidity of air.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: Reducing Pfuel H2O leads to significant growth of jO.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: This effect becomes pronounced at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study

Sentencas: Suppressing jO by humidifying fuel is beneficial to improving the power density of H-SOFCs.
Titulo: Revealing and quantifying the role of oxygen-ionic current in proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells: A modeling study
